page.title: 13POOLSIDE FARM
page.content: Mr.Bedson lives at Poolside Farm in Madeley. He came to live there 33 years ago. Before that the farm belonged to his uncle Fred Bedson. At one time the farm was 95 acres in size, but some of the land was sold to build houses on, and now there are only 75 acres left. On the front of the farmhouse there is carved a sign showing a clenched fist through a crown. This is the symbol that means that the place was once owned by Lord Crewe. Mr.Bedson doesn't like moles. He lays traps for them under the ground, and he has got nine moles hanging on some barbed wire by their noses. Apart from the house (which is dated 1855), he has a small stable which used to be a pigsty. In the backyard there's an old shed where some Polish airmen supposedly hid during the war.
